page.title: 15Footpaths
page.content: Arlington and Berwick have many rights of way. One route is based on the old Roman road, Farnestreet, which ran from Anderida (Pevensey) to Lewes, crossing the Cuckmere River near Chilver Bridge. Around Arlington Reservoir footpaths and stiles are in good condition and well used. The path beside Ludlay Coppice has been cleared recently by the Manpower Services Commission using unemployed people, and is now easy to walk but another through the old brickworks at Berwick Station is overgrown and almost impassable. The long distance Weald Way path from Gravesend to Eastbourne passes through the area and this section is checked yearly by Polegate Field Paths Preservation Society. The Forestry Commission has laid out a short walk at Placket Coppice especially for the disabled and blind.
